Models¶

class bhp_entry.models.Entry(*args, **kwargs)¶

Model of metadata for each model_class linked to a visit definition.

This model lists entry forms by visit definition used to fill the scheduled entry bucket for a subject once a visit is reported

Name :

Entry
Table :

bhp_entry_entry
Parameters:
  • time_point (IntegerField) – Time point
  • base_interval (IntegerField) – Interval from base timepoint 0 as an integer.
  • base_interval_unit (CharField) – Base interval unit
  • lower_window (IntegerField) – Window lower bound
  • lower_window_unit (CharField) – Lower bound units
  • upper_window (IntegerField) – Window upper bound
  • upper_window_unit (CharField) – Upper bound units
  • grouping (CharField) – Grouping
  • visit_definition_id (ForeignKey) – Visit definition
  • content_type_map_id (ForeignKey) – Entry form / model
  • entry_order (IntegerField) – Entry order
  • required (CharField) – Required
  • entry_category (CharField) – Entry category
  • entry_window_calculation (CharField) – Base the entry window period on the visit window period or specify a form specific window period
  • default_entry_status (CharField) – Default entry status
class bhp_entry.models.BaseEntryBucket(*args, **kwargs)¶

Base model for list of required entries by registered_subject.

Parameters:
  • registered_subject_id (ForeignKey) – Registered subject
  • current_entry_title (CharField) – Current entry title
  • entry_status (CharField) – Entry status
  • due_datetime (DateTimeField) – Due datetime
  • report_datetime (DateTimeField) – Report datetime
  • entry_comment (TextField) – Entry comment
  • close_datetime (DateTimeField) – Close datetime
  • fill_datetime (DateTimeField) – Fill datetime
class bhp_entry.models.ScheduledEntryBucket(*args, **kwargs)¶

Subject-specific list of required and scheduled entry as per normal visit schedule.

Name :

Subject Scheduled Entry Bucket
Table :

bhp_entry_scheduledentrybucket
Parameters:
  • registered_subject_id (ForeignKey) – Registered subject
  • current_entry_title (CharField) – Current entry title
  • entry_status (CharField) – Entry status
  • due_datetime (DateTimeField) – Due datetime
  • report_datetime (DateTimeField) – Report datetime
  • entry_comment (TextField) – Entry comment
  • close_datetime (DateTimeField) – Close datetime
  • fill_datetime (DateTimeField) – Fill datetime
  • appointment_id (ForeignKey) – Appointment
  • entry_id (ForeignKey) – Entry
is_serialized()¶

Don’t serialize these records as they clutter up the outgoing box and can be regenerated by the consumer.

See example in registered_subject_dashboard.py

class bhp_entry.models.AdditionalEntryBucket(*args, **kwargs)¶

List of required but unscheduled entries by registered_subject such as off-study, death, adverse event, etc (not attached to appointment model).

This model differs from ScheduledEntryBucket in that it is not attached to an appointment/visit_definition. Also, it is not attached to the Entry model and instead refers directly to the ContentType model.

Name :

Subject Additional Entry Bucket
Table :

bhp_entry_additionalentrybucket
Parameters:
  • registered_subject_id (ForeignKey) – Registered subject
  • current_entry_title (CharField) – Current entry title
  • entry_status (CharField) – Entry status
  • due_datetime (DateTimeField) – Due datetime
  • report_datetime (DateTimeField) – Report datetime
  • entry_comment (TextField) – Entry comment
  • close_datetime (DateTimeField) – Close datetime
  • fill_datetime (DateTimeField) – Fill datetime
  • rule_name (CharField) – Name of rule that created the entry
  • content_type_map_id (ForeignKey) – Entry form / model
is_keyed()¶

Confirm if model instance exists / is_keyed.
